sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; function LearningAWS() { return (

AWS Learning Resources

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a subsidiary of Amazon providing on-demand cloud computing platforms and APIs to individuals, companies, and governments, on a metered pay-as-you-go basis. With a vast toolset that spans compute power, database storage, and content delivery services, AWS has become a leading choice for many organizations' cloud needs.

Online Courses

  • AWS Training and Certification
  • AWS Certification Courses - Udemy
  • AWS Courses - Coursera

Books

  • "AWS Certified Solutions Architect Official Study Guide" by Joe Baron
  • "AWS For Admins For Dummies" by John Paul Mueller

Websites & Blogs

  • AWS Official Blog
  • A Cloud Guru Blog

Interactive Platforms

  • Qwiklabs - Hands-on AWS Labs

Remember, AWS offers a wide range of services, and the best way to master them is by getting hands-on experience. Set up a free tier account and start experimenting. Good luck on your AWS learning journey!

); } export default LearningAWS;
